channel.title: Setting up a Dell PowerEdge 2850 Server?
channel.description:
Okay, I'm having a issue with this god forsaken server. I don't know what I'm doing wrong anymore. Here's some of it's specs: Dual 3.40 Ghz Processors (I do not know if it's Intel or what ever.) 6 HDD's with ~146Gb's on them each. 6Gb of RAM.
I got the server for free, including all the contents. I have access to Windows Server 2012, and Windows Server 2008 (R2 and plain); plus a bunch others but I don't know them all, they are all legal and real copies. Yestarday I just finished formatting all the drives and setting up RAID. On drives 0 and 1 I set it to RAID 1 (Mirroring), this is for the OS, in case one fails, it has a back up. The other 4 are set up to RAID 5 (Striping with parity). Again, this is in case something fails. Now I need to get an OS onto it. I cannot install via USB, which really kills me considering I have no more DVD's. However, I just made a Windows 2012 disc and a Windows 08 disc. Neither want to work. If I run the 2012 one it gives me an error saying I'm missing some dll file. If I run the 08 one it jumps to blue screen saying: STOP: c0002e3 Security Accounts Manager initialization failed because of the following error: Unmapped Error Error Status: 0x0000001 Please click OK to shutdown this system and reboot into Safe Mode, check the event log for more detailed information.
I cannot click anything, there is no safe mode, and the event log would only be there if I had a OS.
How do I get this shit working.

item.title: Setting up a Dell PowerEdge 2850 Server?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Jmood:

Sounds like your two discs are a bunch of crap, you said these are legal copies yet then you say you made them?

They are 100% legal. Have you heard of Dreamspark? It’s a thing ran by windows. I have access to server downloads, I have to download the .iso and burn them to disc.

Read full topic
item.source: Setting up a Dell PowerEdge 2850 Server?

item.title: Setting up a Dell PowerEdge 2850 Server?
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

I know a few windows installations don’t include third party raid drivers so you will need to go dells website and grab them probably.

Read full topic

item.title: Setting up a Dell PowerEdge 2850 Server?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Okay, I’m having a issue with this god forsaken server. I don’t know what I’m doing wrong anymore.
Here’s some of it’s specs:
Dual 3.40 Ghz Processors (I do not know if it’s Intel or what ever.)
6 HDD’s with ~146Gb’s on them each.
6Gb of RAM.

I got the server for free, including all the contents. I have access to Windows Server 2012, and Windows Server 2008 (R2 and plain); plus a bunch others but I don’t know them all, they are all legal and real copies.
Yestarday I just finished formatting all the drives and setting up RAID. On drives 0 and 1 I set it to RAID 1 (Mirroring), this is for the OS, in case one fails, it has a back up. The other 4 are set up to RAID 5 (Striping with parity). Again, this is in case something fails.
Now I need to get an OS onto it. I cannot install via USB, which really kills me considering I have no more DVD’s. However, I just made a Windows 2012 disc and a Windows 08 disc.
Neither want to work. If I run the 2012 one it gives me an error saying I’m missing some dll file. If I run the 08 one it jumps to blue screen saying:
STOP: c0002e3 Security Accounts Manager initialization failed because of the following error:
Unmapped Error
Error Status: 0x0000001
Please click OK to shutdown this system and reboot into Safe Mode, check the event log for more detailed information.

I cannot click anything, there is no safe mode, and the event log would only be there if I had a OS.

How do I get this shit working.

Read full topic
item.source: Setting up a Dell PowerEdge 2850 Server?
